utterance.speaker: COXSWAIN
utterance.content: Hold water. Hold water.

utterance.speaker: ROWER
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: Gruesome murders, chills and thrills, it’s what author Richard Castle is known for. And he’s delivered yet again with two new books, Wild Storm and Raging Heat. Thank you for joining us this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My pleasure.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: But perhaps the bigger mystery is the one that surrounds you. Your disappearance made national headlines. Months later you were found in a dinghy at sea, yet you claim to have no memory of where you’d been or how you got there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I know it … uh … sounds crazy, even to me, and we’re still looking for answers.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: Well your critics seem to have some. It’s no secret your last book, Wild Storm, slipped off the bestseller list. Isn’t the most logical explanation that this is all a publicity stunt? A way to make headlines to drum up book sales?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I assure you, Brooke, it was no publicity stunt. I would never do that to my family or my fiancée.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: Speaking of you fiancée, you vanished just moments before your wedding. What do you say to fans who chalk your disappearance up to cold feet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I would say that they don’t know what they’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: So the wedding’s still on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well we’ve – been through a very tough experience. We’re still trying to make sense of everything. Actually, I – I just – I came here to talk about my books.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: And if this were one of your books, Mr. Castle, wouldn’t you find the plot a little hard to swallow? I mean, amnesia? Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well this isn’t a novel, Brooke. This actually happened. And no one wants the truth more than I do. And I can prove it. I’m offering a reward. Two hundred and fifty thousand dollars to anyone who can give me verifiable proof as to where I was and exactly what I was doing during the two months I was missing.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: That wasn’t an interview. That was an ambush. And what were you thinking, offering a quarter million dollar reward?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Genius, right? I don’t know why I didn’t think of it sooner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe because you knew it was going to lure crackpots and opportunists. And instead of going after real leads we’re going to be chasing thousands of half-baked tipsters playing the Richard Castle lottery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What real leads? So far we’ve had nothing but dead ends and I’m tired of not knowing. No, to find a needle in a haystack do we not first need a haystack?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but not a haystack full of nutjobs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You saw that interview. No one believes me. But somewhere out there someone knows where I was and what I was doing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You ready for this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A mystery I might be able to solve? It’ll be a relief.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Castle. Welcome back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. I hear the East River’s a little more polluted than usual today.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. A crew team, they found the body in the river wrapped in plastic. Someone probably dumped it hoping to make it disappear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They didn’t weigh it down enough. So, who’s the victim?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he didn’t have an ID on him but we matched it to a missing persons. Wallace Williger, 45. Owner and CEO of Williger Toys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Makers of Sunshine Sara.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sunshine Sara?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s a spunky red-headed rag doll. Alexis’s favorite when she was growing up. Wouldn’t go anywhere without her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did he go missing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Last Friday, so four days ago. His wife, Samantha, said he went off to the movies and never came back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something I should know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, Beckett didn’t tell you? Yeah, yeah. Your disappearance kind of drove them back together. Life being short and all that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. Disappear for two months.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: So the prelim exam indicates his neck was broken.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Probably after a struggle given his defensive wounds.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Luckily his body was wrapped when it went into the water. I may still be able to pull the attacker’s DNA from under the victim’s nails.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, how long has he been dead?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: At least a couple of days.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened to his face and hands? They look like they’ve been burned.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Honestly, I don’t know. But the rest of the body wasn’t affected. I’ll know more when I get him back to the lab.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA WILLIGER
utterance.content: I had that sick feeling when he didn’t come home. I – you hope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Williger, was there anyone that would have wanted to do your husband any harm?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: No. He made toys for a living. He was a decent man. But –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But what?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: These last few weeks he had been having a hard time. Ever since Annie died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Um … who’s Annie?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Our Labrador retriever. After she died, Wally started working late, coming home after I was asleep, like he was avoiding me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you talk to him about it?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: I tried. He said everything was fine. He was just working on an important project.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about the day that he disappeared? Did he say anything that would indicate he was in trouble?

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: No. He was happy. He told me he loved me. Said things would be better soon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, seeing her? I can’t imagine what it was like for you, all those nights not knowing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I was lucky. You came back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, so we took a look at WILLIGER’s phone and financials. There’s no activity on the day he disappeared.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If he was on his way to the movies either he didn’t make it there or he paid with cash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Canvass local theaters, see if anyone saw him. And take a look at his records for the past couple of weeks. See if there’s anything out of the ordinary there. Castle and I are going to go to his office and check if there were any problems.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Just what in the hell do you think you’re doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you give that TV station the precinct number?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I’m not going to give them my home phone. That’s private.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The NYPD is not your personal secretary. Do you know how many man hours this little stunt of yours is costing us? The phones have been ringing off the hook!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you hear that? Ringing off the hook?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We have leads.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what were you thinking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.” Sun-Su. The tactical smooch is just one weapon in my vast arsenal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well employ it again and the enemy might go nuclear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. But somewhere in this pile is the answer to where I was. I can feel it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Castle, I know how important this is to us. But you have to realize this is a longshot. And I don’t want you to be disappointed if it doesn’t pan out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Toys!

utterance.speaker: MARSHA STOLLER
utterance.content: Wally built this place from the ground up. Seems impossible that he’s gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Stoller, was everything okay at work? Did he have any conflicts with colleagues or business rivals?

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: Not that I’m aware of, and as VP of the company I’m sure I’d know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I understand he was under pressure the past couple of weeks. That he was coming home late.

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: Who told you that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His wife.

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but that’s not true. I mean, he may have been under pressure, but it certainly wasn’t here at work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he wasn’t staying late?

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: No, just the opposite. He was leaving early several days a week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I did not realize this would be on. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know why he was leaving early?

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: No. He said he was taking care of some personal things. It sounded private so I didn’t ask. But maybe he told his assistant. Matt?

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: Did Mr. Williger ever mention to you why he was leaving early?

utterance.speaker: MATT MONROE
utterance.content: No. He was actually pretty secretive about the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You leave these loaded?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So I checked with the vic’s wife. The days Mr. Williger claimed he was working late are the exact same days he was leaving work early.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That leaves about ten to twelve hours over at least a dozen days that he’s unaccounted for. What was he doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I just went back through his phones and financials and they are clean. In fact, they are too clean. From the time he left work on those days to the time he got home there’s no activity at all. No calls or purchases of any kind. Not even subway or cab charges.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So whatever he was doing he wanted to keep it a secret from everyone. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What we could use right now is a crazy Castle theory.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where is Castle anyway?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He needed a time out so I sent him home to check his leads.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lanie … must have … changed my ringtone. Hola paisosa, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Something weird. You know that discoloration on the victims hands and face? It was caused by an industrial cleaner. It looks like someone scrubbed his skin with it, but after he was already dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, Lanie, if the killer was trying to get rid of evidence why would he only scrub the hands and face.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Don’t know, but the cleaner wasn’t bleached based so I still may be able to pull DNA from under the fingernails. I also found a receipt in the victim’s pocket. It’s from a coffee shop in Brooklyn dated the day he disappeared.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Williger lived in Manhattan and his office was in Midtown. What was he doing out in Brooklyn?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you guys canvass the coffee shop for anyone that say Williger. I’ll get a search warrant for his office and house first thing in the morning.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Come on, Kate. It’s his first case back after two months. You didn’t expect everything to be back to normal right away?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Lane. It’s just – it’s just, I want it to be us again. And it’s like there’s this shadow between us. Look, I am – I am choosing to trust him, in spite of all of the evidence. I just … I want to believe that he –

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: But you don’t know if you can.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. And he’s – he’s acting like everything is fine. We both are. But it’s not.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Maybe this reward he’s offering is a good thing. Maybe it’ll lead to the truth.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I don’t want to know what you’re wearing. Now, do you have any information about Richard Castle or not? Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how goes the haystack?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … apparently you were right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nutjobs?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, not all of them. Some are lonely women hoping for a call from the famous Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Ah ha! That will be my date.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, you have a date?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh huh. Robert. We met at the grief counseling group when you were presumed …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You – you picked up a man at grief counseling?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes. Now I will thank you to go into the other room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Because at the moment, our relationship is based on mutual loss and if he finds out that you have returned and are alive it would just – it will ruin everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, you realize I was on television this morning.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Luckily Robert is a cultured man, he does not watch television. They only newspaper he reads is The Wall Street Journal, which thankfully, did not carry news of your return. So, go. Go. Go, go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m sure she means well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it’s not that. It’s just – uh – I really thought someone out there could help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll figure this out, Castle. Together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me. Hello?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. I understand you’re looking for answers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is this? How did you get this number?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Because I know things. Including what happened to you. Are you ready to head the truth?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t like this. I should go with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He said I had to come alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but you don’t even know who he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He sounded like a spy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think this has something to do about your father?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It doesn’t seem like his style. It’s time.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Walk with me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: The less you know the better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you know what happened to me. How?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Because I was with you. I don’t expect you to remember. Not after what they did. I was lucky I escaped.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Escaped from where?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: The ship.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was on a ship. Which is why I was found at sea. Who’s ship?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: It was a survey vessel, at least that was what they claimed. But I saw weapons on board. I’m pretty sure it was an attack ship.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it was military.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: It must have been. I mean, why else would they keep it on the dark side of the moon? Where our scientists can’t see it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: You know they look like us now? That’s why they took you. To copy your skin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So when you say ship, you mean … spaceship?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: We’ll be defenseless when the invasion comes. We have to find a way to warn people. You can tell people. You were on TV.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I’ll – I’ll warn them. I’ll … tell me again, how did you get my phone number?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: I work for the phone company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course you do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So? What happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I really don’t want to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Would you … ! … knock it off? Come help me search?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry. I don’t know how my parents did it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Raised me, raised all my sisters, put food on the table, and still managed to give me piano lessons. With Jenny not working and all the baby expenses I’m barely making ends meet. I’m probably going to have to get a second job.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like they’re hiring security guards down at their warehouse. A rented cop uniform would look good on you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Find any dark secrets in our victim’s desk?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, this guy’s a saint. Gives to charity, employees love him. As far as I can tell, there’s no indication of any dirty little secrets – There’s something in this drawer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Keys. Brand new. And they’re not to his work or house. A phone, pay as you go. Purchased a month ago using cash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any calls on it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A bunch. All made during that unaccounted time and all made to the same time. A Natalie Mendoza, 28.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s her relation to Williger?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re still running background.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I may have a guess. Wally’s wife said that his behavior changed after their dog died. I checked with the vet, turns out there’s a whole lot more to that story. Now, Wally asked the vet to keep it out of the report so as not to upset his wife, but the dog didn’t just die. She was poisoned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Poisoned?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes. The vet wanted to run a test to find out what the toxin was but for some reason Wally adamantly refused. The vet said he seemed pretty shaken up about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well now it makes perfect sense. A secret phone, keys to his secret love nest, lying to his wife? This is Fatal Attraction. Wally was having an affair and when he when he tried to end it Natalie went all Glenn Close on him, poisoning his dog to send a message.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It would explain why Wally started missing work: to spend time with his mistress.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But in the end it wasn’t enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Mendoza? NYPD. Ms. Mendoza?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s unlocked. Hello? Ms. Mendoza?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Blood?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like her throat’s been slit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re a makeup artist?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE MENDOZA
utterance.content: Mostly for low budget horror. I spent all morning testing out this new look and they went to take a nap.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I just say, the new look? Very effective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Mendoza, what was your relationship with Wally Williger?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wally Williger. He’s the CEO of Williger toys.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I don’t know who that it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Natalie, please don’t lie to us. We’ve got evidence of several dozens of phone calls between the two of you over the past month.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: I’m not lying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The more you deny it the guiltier you look.

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: The guiltier I look for what? Look, I told you, I don’t know him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why was he calling you?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Wait, that’s Wally?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you do know him?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Yeah. But he told me his name was Joe. Joe Meyers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what exactly was your relationship with Joe?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: He hired me. To teach him to do theatrical makeup.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would he need to use theatrical makeup?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Uh, for a research project he was doing? He wanted me to teach him how to completely change his appearance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To what?

utterance.speaker: NATALIE
utterance.content: Um … … he said he was studying society’s reactions to aging and wanted my help to transform him into a 70 year old man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Missing time? Makeup? None of this makes any sense. What’s the CEO of a toy company doing secretly dressing up as an old man?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know, but Natalie said she only taught Wally how to apply the makeup to his hands and face.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The same parts of the body the killer scrubbed. He was trying to remove the makeup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. So Wally’s murder is connected to his secret identity somehow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know that receipt that was in Wally’s pocket, the one from the Brooklyn coffee house? Did teams canvasss it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This morning. But they got no hits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Have them canvasss it again. We might have been looking for the wrong man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, this is Mike and Lauren Adams. They have something you need to see.

utterance.speaker: MIKE ADAMS
utterance.content: About six weeks ago we were on our honeymoon. We just started going through the photos the last couple of days.

utterance.speaker: LAURA ADAMS
utterance.content: Mike took pictures of me everywhere we went. Last night we noticed this.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Here. In the background.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I think that’s you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is me. Who am I talking to?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that’s the guy from the trailer on the Massachusetts coast. The one that lied about you and then disappeared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where was this photo taken?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Montreal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Montreal. What the hell was I doing in Montreal?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So according to the jpeg’s geotag, the photo was taken here – – and here is the building you were coming out of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Montreal Global Bank.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was I doing at a bank?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, the key! The one sewn into your pants when they found you. What if the bank is where it came from?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A safe deposit box.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s the right size.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need to get up there. This is the break we’ve been waiting for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. We’ll go this weekend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We can’t wait for the weekend. We’ve gotta go now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m in the middle of a case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll go! Montreal is a short flight. I’ll be there and back in a couple of hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not after everything we’ve been through. You’re not going alone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She’s right, Dad. You can’t go by yourself. I’ll go with you!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Yes! She’ll go with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have no idea what’s out there. No idea who’s out there. That’s too risky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Canada. How risky could it be? And need I remind you, I’m a grown man. I don’t need to ask your permission. That being said, please, please, please can I go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. But only because I know you’re not going to do anything stupid if she’s with you. Don’t let him do anything stupid.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Promise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Grab your passport. I’ll get the tickets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So uniforms recanvasssed at that coffee shop using that geezer photo. They got a hit. A patron identified old man Wally as a tenant at a nearby building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now we know what Wally’s keys were to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How long has he had this place?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Super said he rented it three weeks ago. Paid cash. At least the old man version of him did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, this is obviously where he came to change.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but to do what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have CSU sweep the room. Let’s talk to neighbors, see if they saw anything.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s it, the building in the photo. Any of it look familiar?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You really think the answer’s inside?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only one way to find out.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, where are you going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To open box number 38.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You can’t just walk into a safe deposit room. You need account info, signature cards. We don’t’ even know if that key came from here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have a plan.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi there. I’m wondering if you can help me. I’d like to rent a safe deposit box.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the neighbor doesn’t remember any visitors and she never saw young Wally, but old Wally was paying her to walk and feed the dog.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Another apartment, another dog, dressing up like this. What was this guy doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but whatever it was it got him killed. Why don’t you take him to the vet. Maybe he’s got a microchip that’ll tell us where he came from.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett? Looks like our old man was fond of Chinese food. This is from a restaurant half a dozen subway stops away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a long way to go for takeout.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. So I called over there. Turns out old man Wally was a regular there over the last several weeks, stopping by late every other night, always paying cash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wherever he was going it was near that restaurant.

utterance.speaker: BANK MANAGER
utterance.content: There you go, Mr. Castle. Box 115.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. And, may I ask you something? Do I look familiar to you?

utterance.speaker: BANK MANAGER
utterance.content: Uh, no. I don’t believe so. Have we met?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess not. My mistake. Is it possible to access this box today?

utterance.speaker: BANK MANAGER
utterance.content: Of course. Would you please take Mr. Castle back to the safe deposit box?

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Follow me, sir.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Which box, sir?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: If it’s not the right key we’ll get caught.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Sir?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. There we are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No problem. Just – - a little sticky.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Are you sure you have the right box?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Positive.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: I’ll just check with the manager.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Let’s try one more time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There we go. It was just a little sticky.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What do you think’s inside?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Someone went to a lot of trouble to make sure I had a key.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You ready?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, that’s your handwriting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t remember writing those.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: They’re letters addressed to Beckett, Gram, and … me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A memory card?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, here’s the restaurant. I’ll start a canvasss. See if anyone else around here knows what the hell our victim was doing in the area.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t bother. I think I know where he was coming from.

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: Excuse me, can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. I’m Detective Beckett, this is Detective Ryan. Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s Joe.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Exactly how do you know him?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: He’s a janitor here. I hired him part time two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: WORKER
utterance.content: Hey Mac?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: Yeah? Excuse me one second.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, that’s why he made himself up. He didn’t want his employees to recognize him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s the CEO of a company doing working as a janitor in his own warehouse?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Undercover Boss. But what was he going undercover for?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: He was a quiet guy. He kept to himself mostly. I never would have guessed he was the CEO.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was he working here last Friday?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: Yeah. In fact, he came in for his shift at 4, he left at 11, and then on Monday he didn’t show.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did anything unusual happen that day?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, were they any problems here? Any reason that Mr. Williger would want to go undercover?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: No. He and his team came in last month for their quarterly inspection and we got a glowing report.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well how about when he was here as a janitor. Did he do or say anything out of the ordinary?

utterance.speaker: WORKER
utterance.content: There was that thing, last week.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … what thing?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: One of the guards caught him in the back office after hours rifling through some paperwork.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of paperwork?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: Manifests, mostly. Tracking shipments from our factory. The guard admonished him, he apologized, everybody moved on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we need to see those manifests.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I talked to his wife, his colleagues. If any of them know what Wally was doing around his warehouse they’re not admitting to it. How about you? What did you find?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Aside from our country outsourcing all its manufacturing needs to Asia, everything seems to be in order.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Slow down, slow down!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How’d it go?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Struck out. Rover here didn’t have a microchip, so we still don’t know where he came from. But the vet said he’s in perfect health.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know what I don’t get? Why did he have a dog? I mean, was it part of his cover? Of did it have something to do with his own dog’s death?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re missing something. Something that makes all of this make sense. Ryan, can you look into security camera footage around Wally’s warehouse the night that he disappeared? I want to find out where he went.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right. Come on, boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A memory card.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, there were three of them in three separate envelopes. One for Alexis, one for my mother, and one for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s on it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Watch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, if you’re seeing this … well, if you’re seeing this, I’m probably dead. I want you to know, I never intended to leave you, not like this, not on our wedding day, but I – it wasn’t my choice. I wish I could tell you what’s going on, I wish I could explain … but just know that I love you. I’ve always loved you. Always.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The ones to Alexis and my mother were pretty much the same. Kate, what did I do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. I don’t. But maybe there’s a way we can find out.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: There’s no metadata on the file and it wasn’t geotagged.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there any other way to find out where this was taken?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe there’s something in the room, or something in the audio.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: The recording’s low quality so there’s not much to go on, but I’ll see what I can dig up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s weird. Before I saw that, all I wanted to know was where I was and what I was doing. Now I’m not so sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any news about your undercover boss?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Every answer just leads to more questions. I have no idea what he was doing at that warehouse or what this guy was doing with him. Actually, I was kind of hoping you’d help me with a crazy theory.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry, I’m fresh out. How about a kiss?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think he was a nun in a previous life?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective, what do you have in your pocket?

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE
utterance.content: Evidence. From a bust. My girl was dealing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he’s not just a dog. He’s a trained drug dog.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I have a crazy theory for you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s what you think Wally was up to? Well that’s the craziest theory I’ve ever heard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I admit, it’s crazy. But it’s the only story that matches all the facts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle’s right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Even if he is, it’s still just a story. We don’t have any proof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I know how we can find some.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you coming with me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, if you don’t mind I’d like to stay here for a while.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll be back soon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any luck?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I know this much: you were in a city.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you tell?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Out the window.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s completely white.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Not completely.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Skyscrapers. So do you know where this is?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: No. But this view out the window, the configuration of buildings, ought to be unique.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you can find it.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Theoretically. But comparing this data set to global 3D mapping would take forever. And more computing power than I have.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if we narrowed it to just one city? Montreal. Could you do it then?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I don’t know. Best I can do is try.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can’t imagine how freaky it must be getting a message from myself and not remember recording it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’s he doing with it all?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He needs answers. We both do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long do you think this is going to take?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Hell if I know. I’m not even sure it’s going to work.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: This is Ellis. I’m on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s see if Castle was right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Easy, boy. Easy!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s really going crazy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Come on, boy.

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: Hey! What the hell’s going on here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did they boxes come from?

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: Our manufacturer in China.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Check inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Drugs. Who’s in charge of this shipment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: McElroy!

utterance.speaker: MAC
utterance.content: Please, no, I swear! I didn’t kill him!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? They who did?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Ms. Stoller, they insisted.

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: That’s fine, Matt. We were just going over the company’s finances with Mrs. Williger.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Has there been any progress in the investigation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, there has. We know why your husband was killed, and it started with your dog.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: My dog? Annie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. A month ago your husband went to the company warehouse in Brooklyn. We believe that while he was there he picked up a Sunshine Sarah doll to use as a chew toy for Annie.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Yes, she loved those dolls.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Except this one killed her.

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There were drugs inside of it.

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: That’s impossible.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s most likely what Wally though and why he started wearing disguises, leaving early, and coming home late.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He went back to the warehouse, day after day, trying to figure out what had happened. Until he got too close and they had him killed.

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Who had him killed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The drug ring run out of your warehouse. They were smuggling heroin into the country from China inside of those dolls.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ms. Stoller, we talked to your foreman. He told us how the night shift would remove the drugs from the dolls before returning them to the inventory.

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: There’s no way our warehouse employees could pull that off. All of those shipments are coordinated from here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. From this office. Which means whoever was in charge of it had to have access to Mr. Williger’s files.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’re you going, bro?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Oh, I’m – I’m just –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’ll never make it.

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: Matt?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Matt Monroe. Before he joined the company he was living over in Asia. In fact, that’s one of the reasons Williger hired you, your familiarity with local cultures.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I guess Mr. Williger wasn’t aware that familiarity extended to their heroin trade. The foreman said you were behind the whole operation.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: He’s lying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? Because he said that he called you, told you he was suspicious about the new janitor who had been poking around. You said you’d take care of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was the same night that Mr. Williger disappeared.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It must have been quite a surprise when you realized the old man was your boss.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We double checked street cams. This is your car, three blocks from the warehouse, just after Wally ended his shift.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I bet the DNA samples that we collect are going to confirm what we already know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Matt Monroe, you’re under arrest for the murder of Wally Williger.

utterance.speaker: MARSHA
utterance.content: Detective, if Wally knew something was wrong why did he hide it from everyone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He didn’t know who he could trust and he couldn’t go to the authorities because –

utterance.speaker: SAMANTHA
utterance.content: Because our company name would become synonymous with drug smuggling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Hey, it’s Tory. Is Castle with you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I think he might be in Montreal.

utterance.speaker: HENRY JENKINS
utterance.content: You weren’t supposed to come back.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: Ever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s you.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: What do you remember?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: That’s good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you’re involved. I know you know what happened to me. Who are you?

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: You can’t be doing this. Asking questions, offering rewards; it’s too dangerous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then tell me what happened!

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: You’re not listening, Mr. Castle. You need to stop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or what?

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: Or you’re going to find out the truth. And you said you didn’t want to remember. We went to great lengths to make sure you didn’t. But if you keep looking –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s no way in hell I asked for this.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: I’m sorry. But you did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t believe you.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: Hollander’s Woods, Mr. Castle. That February day when you were 11 years old.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: What happened to you there, the real reason you became a mystery writer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you – I never told anyone about that.

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: No. Not Beckett, not your family. But you told me. Three weeks ago. So that if this ever happened you’d have proof. You’d know that you were the one who asked to forget.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I asked for this?

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: Some mysteries aren’t meant to be solved. It’s over, now. Go home. Live your life. Forget this ever happened. It’s what you wanted.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How could you go up there on your own and not even tell us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I knew you would try and stop me and I needed to know. But … but now … what could I have done that was so bad that I asked them to make me forget?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maybe you didn’t do anything. Maybe you found out something terrible or witnessed something terrible you didn’t want to have to live with.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Or maybe the past two months is like Pandora’s Box and shouldn’t be opened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What I did to them, to you … how am I supposed to just let that go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. I tried with my mom’s murder. I buried it until you came along.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think it’s possible? To live with it without ever knowing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Castle. This is completely different. Whatever happened to you, you already knew the truth and you decided you didn’t want to remember it anymore. And as much as we wanted to know the answers, if you decided that then there had to have been a reason.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe that’s why I asked them to make me forget. So I could come home to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We should get married. Tomorrow. First thing. Put all this behind us. What do you say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Babe, there is nothing more that I want than to marry you. But not like this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not ready.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, we’re both not ready. We’re looking for solid ground and you think that getting married is going to fix the way you feel and it won’t. Look, I love you. And I’m here for you. But we need to get some distance from all of this. We need to get back to our own lives. Find solid ground together. I promise you, I’m not going anywhere. We’ve waited this long, so let’s just make it right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A month? No expectations, no pressure. Just us? And then we’ll talk about it then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A month. It’s a date.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
